channel.title: RS2+RSC Server Emulation
channel.description:
i remember talking to Speljohan_ awhile ago on irc when we were talking about games, he told me about a game called, ugh forgot now but basically they had a first version, client looked like shit then few years later they made a better one, then after that they made an even better one (full 3d) and all the clients had support to connecting to the 1 server. you could simply pick which type of client you wanted to play on (wheather it be a WoW-like one, or looking like RSC, you could still do pretty much all the same things, and interact with people on the WoW-like one)
I was thinking about taking the RSCD emu and adding RS2 client support, and slowly adding whatever is possibly that can visually be shared between the 2 (without looking weird)
there could be a lot of downsides to this, RS2 client has all those other attack properties (stab, slash etc) which i would not implement. the rs2 client would be limited to gameplay.
just an idea

item.title: RS2+RSC Server Emulation
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Ha xD funny:

well the 317 and the 508 HD is actually quite simple. say if you didn’t change the protocol on the 508 client and wanted to get it connected to the 317 server the HD client has a extra byte what tells the server its HD. so if you say logged in with the hd client you get the login method to first check if its HD or if its the 317 client then you send the selected client to the 317 protocol or the 508. but if you changed the 508 client protocol (y) to you

The whole protocol is randomized between versions, and there are major differences in how interfaces work between the old and new engines.

Again, plugins are used to add support for more client versions, so if I did add support for RSC, the plugin could use different combat code then the RS2 clients, since it is what decodes the packets. I’ll have to take a look at the RSC protocol, but I think this would actually be fun to do.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2+RSC Server Emulation
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“The_AFKer, post:28, topic:323863”][quote author=Peeter link=topic=420266.msg3088414#msg3088414 date=1262679159]

What would be the point of using the RS2 client honestly? You’d be stripping most of it (since the gameplay has dramatically changed) and really only using it for graphics enhancement…even then it’d look horribly awkward since the 3D environment was built for more realistic functions (like running, kicking, punching).

A stripped out 508 HD client vs RSC gfx… Would still look awesome.

If you say so, but to me it’d destroy the “simplified” mindset everyone was use to.

Why is everyone (read: developers) so stuck on “keeping it original” mindset?

Having been an ex-behind the scenes developer, adding custom content was purely a waste of effort. You should know this, from DQ.

I’ve come to the conclusion on this, having talked to players over the past months it’s mainly because:

  1. Reviving simulated gameplay from it’s peak (2003-2005), therefore new content is introduced pre-maturely or overbearing for most.

Having edited client-side sprites, windows, you name it, it always ended up too much. As i’ve told others before, ideally you would need people fresh into the scene, having never played Runescape before to accomplish simply because they couldn’t try to compare to as what it use to be. Therefore new content can slowly be added and modified to the user’s liking, and perhaps actually develop into a far more advanced game. Unfortunately though, this community will never learn from its mistakes and move on.

DQ was a success… it only went down due to massive attacks.

As for new people in the scene… imo that’s the wrong way to go about it. You need veteran players who can point out the “flaws”. People who know what’s good and bad in the game.

I have to disagree. Although it may help out the developer(s) with veteran players who were use to the system, there will ALWAYS be the few who decide to try to convince everyone to keep it the same. It’s an on-going cycle, essentially you will make it to a point where you will have to stop before the gameplay gets “too advanced” for your players, then what?

If a person has a valid claim, he/she can explain why something should stay the change. Generally just ignore “IT WASNT INT CLASSIC, KEEP IT ORIGINAL” comments.
[/quote]

If it were only that easy, I think i’d want to keep my players instead of blantly ignoring their requests. Although, that’s probably why i’ve never been successful at administrating any server. Good luck to you or anyone who’s successful in this.[/quote]

If you ask for feedback from your players and point out that they have to post a valid reason for their opinion (e.g. disallow posts like “keep it original”), then it’s not ignoring your players. It’s asking your players to defend their opinions/values, and if they fail to do so, you simply don’t count them as “votes”.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2+RSC Server Emulation
item.dc:creator: @The_AFKer The_AFKer
item.description:
@The_AFKer wrote:

[quote=“Peeter, post:27, topic:323863”][quote author=The_AFKer link=topic=420266.msg3088413#msg3088413 date=1262678416]

What would be the point of using the RS2 client honestly? You’d be stripping most of it (since the gameplay has dramatically changed) and really only using it for graphics enhancement…even then it’d look horribly awkward since the 3D environment was built for more realistic functions (like running, kicking, punching).

A stripped out 508 HD client vs RSC gfx… Would still look awesome.

If you say so, but to me it’d destroy the “simplified” mindset everyone was use to.

Why is everyone (read: developers) so stuck on “keeping it original” mindset?

Having been an ex-behind the scenes developer, adding custom content was purely a waste of effort. You should know this, from DQ.

I’ve come to the conclusion on this, having talked to players over the past months it’s mainly because:

  1. Reviving simulated gameplay from it’s peak (2003-2005), therefore new content is introduced pre-maturely or overbearing for most.

Having edited client-side sprites, windows, you name it, it always ended up too much. As i’ve told others before, ideally you would need people fresh into the scene, having never played Runescape before to accomplish simply because they couldn’t try to compare to as what it use to be. Therefore new content can slowly be added and modified to the user’s liking, and perhaps actually develop into a far more advanced game. Unfortunately though, this community will never learn from its mistakes and move on.

DQ was a success… it only went down due to massive attacks.

As for new people in the scene… imo that’s the wrong way to go about it. You need veteran players who can point out the “flaws”. People who know what’s good and bad in the game.

I have to disagree. Although it may help out the developer(s) with veteran players who were use to the system, there will ALWAYS be the few who decide to try to convince everyone to keep it the same. It’s an on-going cycle, essentially you will make it to a point where you will have to stop before the gameplay gets “too advanced” for your players, then what?

[/quote]

If a person has a valid claim, he/she can explain why something should stay the change. Generally just ignore “IT WASNT INT CLASSIC, KEEP IT ORIGINAL” comments.[/quote]

If it were only that easy, I think i’d want to keep my players instead of blantly ignoring their requests. Although, that’s probably why i’ve never been successful at administrating any server. Good luck to you or anyone who’s successful in this.

Read full topic

You’d be stripping most of it (since the gameplay has dramatically changed) and really only using it for graphics enhancement…even then it’d look horribly awkward since the 3D environment was built for more realistic functions (like running, kicking, punching).

A stripped out 508 HD client vs RSC gfx… Would still look awesome.

If you say so, but to me it’d destroy the “simplified” mindset everyone was use to.

Why is everyone (read: developers) so stuck on “keeping it original” mindset?

Having edited client-side sprites, windows, you name it, it always ended up too much. Therefore new content can slowly be added and modified to the user’s liking, and perhaps actually develop into a far more advanced game. Unfortunately though, this community will never learn from its mistakes and move on.

DQ was a success… it only went down due to massive attacks.

As for new people in the scene… imo that’s the wrong way to go about it. You need veteran players who can point out the “flaws”. People who know what’s good and bad in the game.
[/quote]

I have to disagree. Although it may help out the developer(s) with veteran players who were use to the system, there will ALWAYS be the few who decide to try to convince everyone to keep it the same. It’s an on-going cycle, essentially you will make it to a point where you will have to stop before the gameplay gets “too advanced” for your players, then what?[/quote]

If a person has a valid claim, he/she can explain why something should stay the change. Generally just ignore “IT WASNT INT CLASSIC, KEEP IT ORIGINAL” comments.

item.title: RS2+RSC Server Emulation
item.dc:creator: @The_AFKer The_AFKer
item.description:
@The_AFKer wrote:

[quote=“Peeter, post:23, topic:323863”][quote author=The_AFKer link=topic=420266.msg3088408#msg3088408 date=1262676776]

What would be the point of using the RS2 client honestly? You’d be stripping most of it (since the gameplay has dramatically changed) and really only using it for graphics enhancement…even then it’d look horribly awkward since the 3D environment was built for more realistic functions (like running, kicking, punching).

A stripped out 508 HD client vs RSC gfx… Would still look awesome.

If you say so, but to me it’d destroy the “simplified” mindset everyone was use to.
[/quote]

Why is everyone (read: developers) so stuck on “keeping it original” mindset?[/quote]

Having been an ex-behind the scenes developer, adding custom content was purely a waste of effort. You should know this, from DQ.

I’ve come to the conclusion on this, having talked to players over the past months it’s mainly because:

  1. Reviving simulated gameplay from it’s peak (2003-2005), therefore new content is introduced pre-maturely or overbearing for most.

Having edited client-side sprites, windows, you name it, it always ended up too much. As i’ve told others before, ideally you would need people fresh into the scene, having never played Runescape simply because they couldn’t try to compare to as what it use to be. Therefore new content can slowly be added and modified to the user’s liking, and perhaps actually develop into a far more advanced game. Unfortunately though, this community will never learn from its mistakes and move on.

Read full topic

item.title: RS2+RSC Server Emulation
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

Well, if I wrote a server and a client and then created a whole new client, I’d probably keep the server side pretty much the same just out of simplicity. While I never went on a RS2 client and the RSC client at the same time to verify I was indeed on a RS2 world, the friends of mine who were on the RS2 beta world that I joined while on RSC who I PMed said that I was on their RS2 beta world. It was a long time ago and I wish I had studied it more in depth.

Read full topic
